question.text: Select the incorrect statement about photoperiodism.

options.text: The site of perception of light/dark duration are the leaves.
Flowering in certain plants depends not only on a combination of light and dark exposures but also their relative durations.
The hypothesised hormonal substance migrates from shoot apices to leaves for inducing flowering.
Shoot apices modify themselves into flowering apices prior to flowering.

solution.text: The response of plants to periods of day/night is termed photoperiodism. It has been hypothesised that there is a hormonal substance(s) that is responsible for flowering. This hormonal substance migrates from leaves to shoot apices for inducing flowering only when the plants are exposed to the necessary inductive photoperiod.
